result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Scott Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed

Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment  pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.195 is DENIED because it is not in the public interest.  Written reasons included in signed order of the Court.  
cc: file, defendant, and state.
Successor court.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Copy of the Decision and Order Denying Request for Good Time; filed.  NO FORWARDING ADDRESS.
Denying Request for Good Time; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for good time.

Defendant Michael L Scott in court with attorney Christopher S. Carson.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:    Sentencing proceeds. No corrections made to PSI report. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS, concurrent to each other.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS. 
Credit given for 14 days time served if revoked.

Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin of Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 12 MONTHS "condition time" at the House of Corrections with release privileges for employment, school, AODA treatment, and anger management counseling purposes only.
* No contact with the victims.
* No contact with UW- Milwaukee.
* No contact with the co-actors, Andre Dallas and Rendell Giles.
* Complete an anger management counseling program.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with any other counseling deemed appropriate by the Probation Department and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless already done) and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $20.00 to the victim, Brittney H., joint and several, with co-actors Andre Dallas (14CF768) AND Rendell Giles (14CF769).  To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $40.00 to the victim, Victor B., joint and several, with co-actors Andre Dallas (14CF768) AND Rendell Giles (14CF769). To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $50.00 to the victim, Gavin L., joint and several, with co-actors Andre Dallas (14CF768) AND Rendell Giles (14CF769). To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $100.00 to the victim, Colin L., joint and several, with co-actors Andre Dallas (14CF768) AND Rendell Giles (14CF769). To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Michael L Scott in court with attorney Christopher S. Carson.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The PSI report quotes the defendant making a statement that potentially creates a problem in this case.
Statements made.
Court, on its own motion, adjourns this matter to hear from the PSI writer.
Case adjourned to 09-26-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

**Defendant's conditions of bail release remain the same.
for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to Probation Department for processing.

Filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Michael L Scott in court with attorney Christopher S Carson.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #4 and Count #5 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

**Court ordered a Presentence Investigation Report with a sentencing recommendation.

Case adjourned to 08-07-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Michael L Scott in court with attorney Christopher S Carson.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing in Branch 2. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date received, signed, and filed with court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael L Scott in court with attorney Christopher S Carson.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Off record - court is in trial.

Parties are still under negotiations.

Defendant Michael L Scott in court with attorney Christopher S. Carson.  Timothy Cotter for Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Steven Swiertz-UWM Law Enforcement Officer,  Christopher Schuster-UWM Law Enforcement Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
$1000.00 cash bail to be returned to the poster (remitter).  Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Any co-actors- Andre Dallas and Rendell Giles. Sandburg Residence Hall and UWM Campus.

Defendant Michael L Scott in court with attorney Christopher S Carson.  Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/14 @ 1:30pm
